verses.text: 預言聖殿被毀耶穌從殿裡出來的時候，有一個門徒對他說：「老師，請看，這是多麼美好的石頭！多麼美好的建築！」

words.note: Can be a noun (prophecy) or a verb (to predict).
Location particle, often with prepositions.

verses.text: 耶穌對他說：「你看見這些偉大的建築嗎？將來必沒有一塊石頭留在另一塊石頭上面，每一塊都要拆下來。」

words.note: Measure word for pieces, lumps, or chunks.

verses.text: 這世代終結的預兆耶穌在橄欖山上，面對聖殿坐著，彼得、雅各、約翰和安得烈私下問他：

words.note: Location particle.

verses.text: 「請告訴我們，甚麼時候會有這些事呢？這一切事將要成就的時候有甚麼預兆呢？」
耶穌就告訴他們說：「你們要小心，不要被人迷惑。
有許多人要來，假冒我的名說『我就是基督』，並且要迷惑許多的人。

words.note: Often implies deceitful imitation.
Emphasizes 'is' or 'it is none other than'.

verses.text: 你們聽見戰爭和戰爭的風聲，也不要驚慌，這是免不了的，不過，結局還沒有到。

words.note: 見 acts as a resultative complement, meaning 'to perceive successfully'.
Literally 'wind sound', often used for rumors or signs of impending events.
Literally 'cannot avoid'.

verses.text: 一個民族要起來攻打另一個民族，一個國家要起來攻打另一個國家，到處要有地震，有饑荒，這些不過是痛苦的開始。

words.note: Can indicate starting an action or a rising motion.

verses.text: 但你們要小心！因為人要把你們交給公議會，你們要在會堂裡被鞭打，又要為我的緣故站在總督和君王面前，向他們作見證。

words.note: Literally 'small heart'; idiomatically 'be careful'.
Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
Refers to the Jewish high court, the Sanhedrin.
Often used in formal contexts or for abstract reasons.
Refers to a high-ranking official, like a Roman governor.
A more literary or formal term for king.
Common in legal and religious contexts, 'to bear witness'.

verses.text: 然而福音必須先傳給萬民。

words.note: A formal way to introduce a contrast or new development.
Literally 'blessed news'.

words.definition: to preach to, pass on to

words.note: Often used in religious contexts to mean 'all humankind'.

verses.text: 人把你們捉去送官的時候，用不著預先思慮要說甚麼，到那時候賜給你們甚麼話，你們就說甚麼，因為說話的不是你們，而是聖靈。
弟兄要出賣弟兄，父親要出賣兒子，甚至把他們置於死地；兒女要悖逆父母，害死他們。

words.note: Can refer to brothers by blood or fellow believers.
Literally 'place into death ground'.

verses.text: 你們為我的名，要被眾人恨惡，然而堅忍到底的必然得救。
大災難的日子「當你們看見『那造成荒涼的可憎者』，站在不該站的地方，那時，住在猶太的應當逃到山上；

words.note: Lit. 'the one who is abominable'.

verses.text: 在房頂的不要下來，也不要進到屋子裡拿甚麼東西；

words.note: Etymology from 'east and west' referring to all things.

verses.text: 在田裡的也不要回去取衣服。

words.note: Forms an adjectival phrase or nominalizes it (e.g., 'the one who is...')
Combined with 不 (bù) to express prohibition.

verses.text: 當那些日子，懷孕的和乳養孩子的有禍了！

words.note: Introduces a temporal phrase.
Turns a verb/adjective into a noun phrase, e.g., 'the pregnant ones'.
Primarily used in formal or biblical contexts for 'nursing'.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who nurse children'.
Often used in biblical pronouncements of judgment ('Woe to...').
Indicates a new situation, completion, or emphasis.

verses.text: 你們應當祈求，不要讓這些事在冬天發生。

words.note: A formal term for prayer or earnest supplication.
Combined with '不' often means 'do not want to' or 'do not let'.

verses.text: 因為那些日子必有災難，這是從 神創世的開始到現在未曾有過的，以後也必不會再有。

words.note: Indicates certainty or strong necessity.
Frequently used in prophetic or eschatological contexts.
Elevated character indicating reverence for God.
Refers to the act of creating the world.
More formal than '從來沒有'.
Forms a descriptive phrase, 'that which has been...'
Indicates possibility or future action.

verses.text: 如果不是主減少那些日子，沒有一個人可以存活；但是為了自己的選民，他必使那些日子減少。

words.note: A common title for God or Jesus in the Bible.
Most common measure word for people and objects.
Means to stay alive or continue to exist.
Refers to those chosen by God.
Functions as a causative verb.

verses.text: 那時，如果有人對你們說：『看哪，基督在這裡！看哪，他在那裡！』你們不要信。

words.note: An exclamation calling for attention, common in biblical texts.
Transliteration of Greek 'Christos'.
An exclamation calling for attention, common in biblical texts.

verses.text: 因為必有假基督和假先知出現，行神蹟和奇事，如果可以的話，連選民也要迷惑了。

words.note: Refers to individuals who falsely claim to be the Messiah.
Refers to individuals who falsely claim to speak for God.
Literally 'divine trace' or 'divine sign'.
Often paired with 神蹟 to denote miraculous events.
Used with '如果' to form '如果...的話' meaning 'if...'
Refers to those chosen by God, often Israel or believers.

verses.text: 所以你們應當小心！我已經事先把一切都告訴你們了。

words.note: Literally 'small heart', meaning to be cautious.
Introduces the object of a verb, placed before the verb.

verses.text: 人子必駕雲降臨「當那些日子，在那災難以後，太陽就變黑了，月亮也不發光，

words.note: A title Jesus used for himself, referring to his humanity and divine authority.

verses.text: 眾星從天墜落，天上的萬象震動。
那時，他們要看見人子，滿有能力和榮耀，駕著雲降臨；

words.note: A title for Jesus in the Gospels.
More formal than simply '有很多'.
Often used for divine or royal arrival.

verses.text: 他要差派天使，把他的選民從四方，從地極直到天邊，都招聚來。

words.note: Lit. 'heavenly messenger'.

verses.text: 「你們應該從無花果樹學個功課：樹枝發出嫩芽長出葉子的時候，你們就知道夏天近了。

words.note: Lit. 'flowerless fruit tree'.

words.definition: to send out, emit, put forth

verses.text: 同樣，你們甚麼時候看見這些事發生，就知道他已經近在門口了。

words.note: An idiom meaning 'very close' or 'about to happen'.

verses.text: 我實在告訴你們，這一切都必會發生，然後這世代才會過去。
天地都要過去，但我的話決不會廢去。

words.note: Refers to something losing its power or validity.

verses.text: 警醒準備「至於那日子和時間，沒有人知道，連天上的天使和子也不知道，只有父知道。

words.note: Often used in a spiritual sense in the Bible.
Literally 'heavenly messenger'.
Refers to Jesus, the Son of God.
Refers to God the Father.

verses.text: 你們要小心，要警醒，因為你們不知道那日期甚麼時候來到。

words.note: Literally 'small heart', meaning to be cautious.

verses.text: 這就像一個人出外遠行，把責任（「責任」原文作「權柄」）一一地交給他的僕人，又吩咐看門的要警醒。

words.note: General measure word for people or objects.
Indicates the following noun is the direct object of the verb.
Transforms a preceding phrase into an adverb.
Turns a preceding verb phrase into a noun phrase, 'the one who watches the gate'.

verses.text: 所以你們要警醒，因為你們不知道家主甚麼時候來到，也許在黃昏，也許在半夜，也許在雞叫時，也許在清晨。

words.note: Refers to the owner or head of a household.
Refers to the time of a rooster's crow, typically early morning before dawn.
Functions as a temporal suffix meaning 'when' or 'at the time of'.

verses.text: 恐怕他忽然來到，發現你們正在睡覺。
我對你們所說的話，也是對眾人說的，『你們要警醒』。」

words.note: Precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase.
Connects verb phrase to a noun, like 'the spoken words'.
Often refers to 'the crowd' or 'everyone' in biblical texts.
Here nominalizes the verb phrase, meaning 'that which is spoken'.
Commonly used in the Bible for spiritual vigilance.
